intro: Psychotria palestinae, commonly known as the Palestine Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in parts of Israel and Palestine. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to the arid and saline conditions of its environment. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
